Question 40.Question: Please describe any differences in how it impacted your learning (comparing GenAI and your teacher)?
Question 40.Response: My answer is based on my whole experience - I have had lecturers who provide exceptional feedback that enabled me to critically engage with my work and to improve it. I have had lecturers who have refused to give feedback or give little to no feedback and this is when I have needed to get "help" elsewhere. GenAI is not always accurate - but when I get nothing or little from the University, at least it gives me somewhere to start.

Question 41.Question: Were there any differences in how the feedback made you feel (comparing GenAI and your teacher)?
Question 41.Response: Yes - GenAI is not supposed to help with my learning - so it is objective and emotionless. I believe that educators should help their students - and so when you get told no - it is subjective and impactful. When lecturers provide you with constructive criticism - I am open to it. I am here to learn.

Question 42.Question: Describe any other differences between the feedback you received from GenAI and your teacher.
Question 42.Response: To some degree I can control the parameters of GenAI :)
